item.title: Self hosting signature equal empty
item.dc:creator: @mak
item.description:
We don’t help with selfhosting unless the person purchases KeyAuth enterprise https://shop.keyauth.cc/product/keyauth-enterprise

The community site is closed now. You can ask your question in the #coding channel of the Discord server KeyAuth

Nobody is required to help you though. If your question is easy to solve with Google, people will likely ignore you.

item.title: KeyAuthApp.download func downloading file with a huge amount of size
item.dc:creator: @mak
item.description:
Make sure you’re using this API link, not an older one: https://keyauth.win/api/1.0/

Also, make sure you’re submitting the direct download link on KeyAuth dashboard. when you go to the link you submit in dashboard, it should download right away. if it doesn’t and you have to click a button or something to download, you submitted the wrong link to KeyAuth

The community site is closed now. You can ask your question in the #coding channel of the Discord server KeyAuth

Nobody is required to help you though. If your question is easy to solve with Google, people will likely ignore you.

item.title: C++ use custom domain error
item.dc:creator: @mak
item.description:
Watch the video it’s quite simple KeyAuth Custom Domains for API. Never deal ISP blockage again! - YouTube

If your domain is https://example.com, then the link you should have in the main.cpp file should be https://example.com/1.2/

The community site is closed now. You can ask your question in the #coding channel of the Discord server KeyAuth

Nobody is required to help you though. If your question is easy to solve with Google, people will likely ignore you.

item.title: LNK2001 error c++
item.dc:creator: @mak
item.description:
You’re supposed to compile as Release x64. If you added the libs to your own project, then you need to make sure your project has the same project configuration settings as the example project. If you can’t figure it out, it’s recommended that you add your code to the example project instead.

The community site is closed now. You can ask your question in the #coding channel of the Discord server KeyAuth

Nobody is required to help you though. If your question is easy to solve with Google, people will likely ignore you.

item.title: KeyAuthApp.download func downloading file with a huge amount of size
item.dc:creator: @Floriam

item.title: KeyAuthApp.download func downloading file with a huge amount of size
item.dc:creator: @focuskid
item.description:
so basically i made some changes to keyauth download func so i can save it to other places so i can keep code minimized but when i added changes to KeyAuthApp.download function it shows 14kb size instead of 7kb which is the orginal size of the file, here is the modified download function code:

	bool download(std::string fileid, std::string output = XorStr("same.exe").c_str(), bool memory = false, unsigned char* ape = 0x00) {
		auto iv = encryption::sha256(encryption::iv_key());
		auto data =
			XorStr("type=").c_str() + encryption::encode("file") +
			XorStr("&fileid=").c_str() + encryption::encrypt(fileid, enckey, iv) +
			XorStr("&sessionid=").c_str() + encryption::encode(sessionid) +
			XorStr("&name=").c_str() + encryption::encode(name) +
			XorStr("&ownerid=").c_str() + encryption::encode(ownerid) +
			XorStr("&init_iv=").c_str() + iv;

		auto response = req(data);
		response = encryption::decrypt(response, enckey, iv);
		auto json = response_decoder.parse(response);

		if (!json["success"])
		{
			error(json[("message")]);
		}

		auto file = encryption::decode(json["contents"]);

		if (memory)
		{
			ape = (unsigned char*)response.data();
		}
		else // Not loading in memory.
		{
			std::ofstream file(output.c_str(), std::ios_base::out | std::ios_base::binary);
			file.write(response.data(), response.size());
			file.close();
		}
	}

example of me using the function below:
KeyAuthApp.download(“965601”, “E:\adoption_recs\test.sys”);

if anyone can help, thx greatly appreciated

item.title: PHP KeyAuth not showing hwid
item.dc:creator: @Projectile_Invalid
item.description:
Hello am having issues with php keyauth, on the keyauth.cc panel I can see the hwid but when I return it from the api on my website I get this

array(6) { [“username”]=> string(10) “Projectile” [“subscriptions”]=> array(2) { [0]=> object(stdClass)#3 (4) { [“subscription”]=> string(9) “developer” [“key”]=> NULL [“expiry”]=> string(11) “32495026860” [“timeleft”]=> int(30831094142) } [1]=> object(stdClass)#4 (4) { [“subscription”]=> string(7) “default” [“key”]=> NULL [“expiry”]=> string(10) “1979448448” [“timeleft”]=> int(315515730) } } [“ip”]=> string(12) “x.xx.xxx.xxx” [“hwid”]=> NULL [“createdate”]=> string(10) “1663878138” [“lastlogin”]=> string(10) “1663932718” }
